A C D E G H I J K L M N P R S T U V W

L

LCA - Class in de.uni_koeln.spinfo.strings.plugin.algo.lca
The Lowest Common Ancestor algorithm of Schieber and Vishkin (sequential version only), roughly as described in "On finding lowest common ancestors: simplification and parallelization", by Baruch Schieber and Uzi Vishkin, SIAM J.
LCA(TreeNode) - Constructor for class de.uni_koeln.spinfo.strings.plugin.algo.lca.LCA
Create a structure used to answer Lowest Common Ancestor queries, from a tree of objects implementing the TreeNode interface, passed by a reference to its root.
LCA(int, int) - Method in class de.uni_koeln.spinfo.strings.plugin.algo.lca.LCA
Work out the lowest common ancestor of two nodes identified by their acceptDFSNum number, in constant time.
lcaCheck(int, int, Random, double, int) - Static method in class de.uni_koeln.spinfo.strings.plugin.algo.lca.TestLCA
Check that the fast LCA algorithm works by comparing it with the result of a slower one.
LCE - Class in de.uni_koeln.spinfo.strings.plugin.algo
This class contains a sketch of what to do to get the LCE through the LCA in constant time.
LCE(String, String) - Constructor for class de.uni_koeln.spinfo.strings.plugin.algo.LCE
Instantiates an LCE with the two texts to find the longest common extension for.
lg2(int) - Static method in class de.uni_koeln.spinfo.strings.plugin.algo.lca.Log2
return floor(log base 2(n)).
Log2 - Class in de.uni_koeln.spinfo.strings.plugin.algo.lca
container for static methods, such as log base 2
Log2() - Constructor for class de.uni_koeln.spinfo.strings.plugin.algo.lca.Log2
 
longestCommonExtension(String, int, String, int) - Static method in class de.uni_koeln.spinfo.strings.plugin.algo.LCE
Naive computation of the longest common extension
longestCommonExtensionWordBased(String[], int, String[], int) - Static method in class de.uni_koeln.spinfo.strings.plugin.algo.LCE
Naive computation of the longest common extension for words/sentences
lowZeros(int) - Static method in class de.uni_koeln.spinfo.strings.plugin.algo.lca.Log2
Return the number of contiguous zeros at the lsb of the input.
